metadata.title: CVE-2021-29922 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: library/std/src/net/parser.rs in Rust before 1.53.0 does not properlyconsider extraneous zero characters at the beginning of an IP addressstring, which (in some situations) allows attackers to bypass accesscontrol that is based on IP addresses, because of unexpected octalinterpretation.

criterions.comment: rustc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
